metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14874 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the __i2b function of the newlib libc library, all versions prior to 3.3.0 (see newlib/libc/stdlib/mprec.c), Balloc is used to allocate a big integer, however no check is performed to verify if the allocation succeeded or not. The access of _ x[0] will trigger a null pointer dereference bug in case of a memory allocation failure.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14874` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnewlib-arm-none-eabi - 3.3.0-1.3
newlib-source - 3.3.0-1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: newlib package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.0-1.3').
